CFM.synopsis: Wyll avatar has obtained the Helm of Balduran, and Ravengard is dead. When he sleeps the following night in camp, he contemplates the choice before him. Note that 99% of the time he will be pacted, but he might have killed Ravengard himself.
CFM.how_to_trigger: Kill Ravengard and then speak with Ansur the dragon.

CFM_16.speaker: Narrator
CFM_16.text: *There will be no great tempest roaring through the skies, no dragon redeemer to help save the city.*

CFM_17.speaker: Narrator
CFM_17.text: *You should have known. You should always have known.*

CFM_30.speaker: Narrator
CFM_30.text: *You are the warrior who will slay the Absolute. You are the guardian who will defend Baldur's Gate.*

CFM_8.speaker: Narrator
CFM_8.text: *When the elder brain has fallen, you could even claim your father's own ducal title and carry his banner.*

CFM_6.speaker: Narrator
CFM_6.text: *Even though you bear the horns of a devil, the patriars and people will recognise your claim.*

CFM_33.speaker: Narrator
CFM_33.text: *Yet you will labour under Mizora's shadow. What fiendish plans could she be concocting?*

CFM_10.speaker: Narrator
CFM_10.text: *Uncertainty grips you. You have reached a fork in your path. In which direction will you travel?*

CFM_32.speaker: Wyll
CFM_32.text: The Blade is dead. You will be Wyll Ravengard, proud and just Duke of Baldur's Gate.

CFM_42.speaker: Narrator
CFM_42.text: *Baldur's Gate is your home, and you are its servant, relentless in your pursuit of the greatest good. You would sooner die by Mizora's hand than endanger the city.*

CFM_13.speaker: Narrator
CFM_13.text: *Baldur's Gate is your home, and you are its servant, relentless in your pursuit of the greatest good.*

CFM_5.speaker: Narrator
CFM_5.text: *Courage. Insight. Strategy. Justice. These were the lessons your father taught you, and the ones by which you will guide your fair city.*

CFM_41.speaker: Narrator
CFM_41.text: *The Blade of Frontiers is dead. You will be Wyll Ravengard, son of Ulder, proud Duke of Baldur's Gate.*

CFM_43.speaker: Narrator
CFM_43.text: *You will make a name for yourself, you will conquer all of the city's ills. The people will know you forever as the Heart of the Gate.*

CFM_27.speaker: Wyll
CFM_27.text: The power is irresistible. You will be a Grand Duke, and the people will cheer your name.

CFM_38.speaker: Narrator
CFM_38.text: *To bend the will of the citizens with a single decree, to turn the heads of your adorers and twist the arms of your opponents: affairs of state are your calling.*

CFM_9.speaker: Narrator
CFM_9.text: *You will tread the same halls as your father and command the same marshals.*

CFM_35.speaker: Narrator
CFM_35.text: *Your father's memory will fade, and you will be the Ravengard the histories remember.*

CFM_45.speaker: Narrator
CFM_45.text: *Your parasite shudders for a moment. Your companions know your path, but only one celebrates it.*

CFM_24.speaker: Narrator
CFM_24.text: *You are overcome with visions of grand battles and ducal intrigue. Your future looks bright indeed.*

CFM_31.speaker: Narrator
CFM_31.text: *Your parasite shudders for a moment. Your companions know your path, but none celebrate it.*

CFM_1.speaker: Wyll
CFM_1.text: You are no aristocrat. You will be the Blade of Avernus, hunter of fiends and foul beasts.

CFM_2.speaker: Narrator
CFM_2.text: *You fought to right the wrongs of the Coast, to slay the men and monsters that hunt the helpless.*

CFM_7.speaker: Narrator
CFM_7.text: *It is in the wilds that you find your courage, not in the florid halls of Upper City estates.*

CFM_22.speaker: Narrator
CFM_22.text: *There will be no Grand Duke Wyll Ravengard. And there will be no Blade of Frontiers.*

CFM_21.speaker: Narrator
CFM_21.text: *For as long as demons and devils imperil the Sword Coast, they will be your prey.*

CFM_29.speaker: Narrator
CFM_29.text: *Your parasite trembles. Even in sleep, your companions know your path, and cry out in victory.*

CFM_4.speaker: Narrator
CFM_4.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Avernus. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

CFM_15.speaker: Wyll
CFM_15.text: You are no aristocrat. You are forever the Blade of Frontiers, hunter of foul beasts.

CFM_47.speaker: Narrator
CFM_47.text: *When evil's shadow darkened the Sword Coast, you brought your light. You are the people's protector. To fell monsters and guard the meek is your calling.*

CFM_0.speaker: Narrator
CFM_0.text: *A calm settles over you. The elder brain is a menace - but you are the Blade of Frontiers. No abomination is too powerful for you to overcome.*

CFM_18.speaker: Wyll
CFM_18.text: You can't be Grand Duke. Mizora would wield too much over Baldur's Gate.

CFM_28.speaker: Narrator
CFM_28.text: *No manner of duke should be tied to a devil's leash. No manner of duke should save a city, only to open a gate to the Hells.*
